executable.title: Evaluate Surface Weight
executable.description:
Evaluate the weights' value for each vertex of the Input Surface.

For each weight image of the Weight Directory, a field array with the weight at the Input Surface vertices is added. It is encouraged to run this module on surface that will be posed as it can speed up processing time.
executable.contributor: Yuanxin Liu (Kitware), Johan Andruejol (Kitware), Julien Finet (Kitware)
executable.acknowledgements: This work is supported by Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL)

directory.name: WeightDirectory
directory.label: Weight Directory
directory.description: The directory that contain the weight images. These images are expected to be in *.mha format and all have the same image dimensions.

geometry.name: InputSurface
geometry.label: Input Surface
geometry.description: The Input Surface for which the weights will be evaluated.

geometry.name: OutputSurface
geometry.label: Weighted Surface
geometry.description: The same as the Input Surface but with the weight vectors stored as point data.

geometry.name: ArmaturePoly
geometry.label: Armature
geometry.description: Optional armature file. It used if MaximumParenthoodDistance > 0

boolean.name: Debug
boolean.label: Debug Mode
boolean.description: Print debug logs and dump intermediate images.

boolean.name: IsSurfaceInRAS
boolean.label: Surface in RAS
boolean.description: Whether the input surface is already in the RAS(Right, Anterior, Superior) coordinate system (true) or in LPS (Left, Posterior, Superior) coordinate system (false, default). If not, it will be be internally transformed into RAS.

boolean.name: IsArmatureInRAS
boolean.label: Armature in RAS
boolean.description: Whether input armature is already in the RAS(Right, Anterior, Superior) coordinate system (true) or in LPS (Left, Posterior, Superior) coordinate system (false, default). If not, it will be internally transformed into RAS.

integer.name: MaximumParenthoodDistance
integer.label: Maximum Parenthood Distance
integer.description: Use this parameter to prevent the interpolation of weights that are too far away in the family tree. For example, with Maximum Parenthood Distance set to 1, the interpolation will be limited to the bone's parent and children. The default (-1) means any distance is allowed.
